website_summaries.verdict: One of the best high-resolution music players available. A must for anyone who wants to hear their music at its best.
pros: It works with both wired and wireless headphones
The touchscreen interface is built on Android, making it easy to use
A great option for entry-level audiophiles
Storage space is easy to expand with an SD card
cons: Upgrading the firmware is more of a pain than it needs to be

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: This DAP is a total waste of money and time. I spent so much time migrating over various albums to an external micor SD card to later hear the player choke, skip and scramble randomly. Before doing so I installed the driver and uploaded directly to the player. I reformatted the card several times. I'm rather tech savvy and all I can say is STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT. YOU'LL HATE YOURSELF FOR BUYING IT.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bemetz

customer_reviews.title: 2 DOA Units..  Both same HeadPhone Jack Issue
customer_reviews.text: First thing I checked out of the box was the Head Phone Jack not working with on headset and the other headset very soft sound in only one ear I returned it for a replacement. Well the replacement is a bit better. Both headsets now have loud sound but only in the left ear. Nothing in the right ear. Both headphones work in multiple other devices I have. So it is the Player. I give up after 2 and just getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Litterick

customer_reviews.title: Does it all
customer_reviews.text: WIll keep this short and to the point.The sound quality is superb.Drives headphones really well.Sounds great on car AUX. This is expandable to fit many hi-rez file with a Micro SD Card.Now the most important feature.The android system copies all your artwork and files properly unlike many players where it's placed in a unknown folder you have to search for.With this player it's easy to navigate and jump around.It appears to be very well made and solid.Finally a affordable player that checks all the boxes.Im a picky and rabid audiophile.And I approve of this player.Easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult set-up process
customer_reviews.text: The set-up instructions are not clear for an English-speaking person. I accidentally pressed a button when removing the product from the packaging and getting it ready for initial set-up. This changed the language from English to an unknown language. I could not figure out how to get it back to English. I reached out to FiiO's customer service, and kudos to them, they were extremely quick in resolving my issue...the instructions provided in their email reply were precise and helped me get back on track within 24 hours. Product has worked flawlessly since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Probably Don't Need It
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the idea of getting a DAP, and have known about this brand for a while. I finally decided to give it a try, and I was honestly disappointed in the end. The sound quality is great, and there is plenty of volume to work with. But I honestly can't say it sounded any better (aside from volume) than what my phone is capable of. With the added combo of no wifi and a laggy interface (yes, I updated to the latest firmware), I can only recommend trying at a much higher price or sticking with your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, good interface, great mp3 player.
customer_reviews.text: My ipod nano died, after ten years, and this is a perfect, if not better replacement. It's easy to setup, easy to navigate through the interface. The sound quality is great, even through the bluetooth. The only bad thing about it is, there isn't any internal storage, and you have to put your music on an SD card, but that isn't a real bother. It has firmware updates, that you can get from the Fiio website, unlike the $20 - $30 mp3 players. For me, it is an all round great choice, and I would recommend the Fiio M7 to a friend, or family member looking for a great mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Tried 2 of these, both had headphone jack problems
customer_reviews.text: Tried one, returned it and tried another. Returning the second one and giving up. Both had headphone jack problems. Tried with 2 x headphones so I know it was the player. Jack was a bit loose in the socket, only got sound on one channel, static noise when the jack moved in the socket etc. Probably a bad manufacturing batch but tired of ordering and returning...
customer_reviews.author: Peter B. Galvin

customer_reviews.title: A great little player at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure that I was going to like the FiiO M7 as much as I did. It is a real step up from my xDuoo X3 which was similarly priced. Sound quality is much improved as is usability. Probably the only negative thing that I can say about it is that I does take a long time to boot up, but once it is up and running it is very responsive. Also I did have to turn off the side buttons as they are in a perfect spot for your fingers to go when you pickup the device so I was always going hitting the button to go the next song. I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: NIIIICE
customer_reviews.text: In today's world of streaming and phone playback devices there is still a real audience for quality dedicated music players and this qualifies. APT-X bluetooth for really good sound and direct wire for sound quality based solely on the quality of reproducer. Works well with everything I have and with good enough quality to expose their shortcomings. Fortunately all my equipment is wicked good because in audio the resulting accuracy of reproduction is only as good as the weakest link in the chain. This is a wicked good player.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. K.

customer_reviews.title: One directional Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Fm is nice wish it would play radio to Bluetooth. Like plug in a cable to the headphone jack for the antennae. Also one directional Bluetooth. Bi-directional Bluetooth would make this more useful. Nice build and player
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works great but question build quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product since Jan 24 2020. Shipping was prompt. Item worked exactly as expected and sounded great. Turned it on a week ago and I noticed a black bar across the bottom of the screen. It’s always been I the supplied case, and has never left my room, let alone bed. That being said nothing is perfect and it’s all about how the seller handles this issue. I’ll be asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not For The Newbie
customer_reviews.text: Fiio - and this goes for other consumer electronics firms - need to understand that not all of their customers are younger millennials that have full knowledge of how these pint-sized musical wonders work. A clear, concise and easily followed owner's manual would be a good start! Grade: F here. These companies with their tech wizards barely into their 20's need to wise-up; they're missing opportunities for sales to older adults, who, like me, cherish the music they own!
customer_reviews.author: C. Wauda

customer_reviews.title: Good Product with one exception
customer_reviews.text: Far better mp3 player then what I've had in the past. Although I use Bluetooth most of the time, I occasionally use ear phone jac with ear plugs. Sound from ear plugs is intermittent. Only hear sound from one left ear plug.
customer_reviews.author: James Martin

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality and poorly functioning touch screen
customer_reviews.text: I found this product to have poor sound quality and a poorly functioning touch screen. Very disappointing. Also, I found quite difficult to set up the device and synch it to my computer. I ended up returning the device and am looking for something of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: FIIO M7 IS CHINESE TRASH
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Doesn't find songs on SD card. Have ordered this item and had it replaced because the last one didn't work, either. So I bought the most expensive SD card I could find, that didn't work either. I've wasted countless hours with Amazon tech support, researching on line, trying to contact someone at the factory (China, don't bother). Three words: BUY SOMETHING ELSE!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound! Five stars for sure.
customer_reviews.text: This DAP sounds great. AptX HD is awesome! Lossless, low latency is awesome. I tested its functionality of being a USB DAC for my PC. The driver that came with the internal memory install on Windows 10 flawlessly. I'm streaming audio though it to my AptX HD capable receiver, and it sound great. I'm really happy with it. Of course, just having it for one day, I cannot verify that the 20 hrs battery life is accurate or not.
customer_reviews.author: Ellison C.

customer_reviews.title: Audio isn't great
customer_reviews.text: Player sounds good. Wanted an update from previous which did not have Bluetooth. Touch screen is good and flows smoothly. The sound is nowhere near as good as my Plenue. With the equalizer the Plenue sounds better. The Fiio also has an FM radio which is a plus. For being a hi-res player i thought sound would have been outstanding. My opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Peters

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Winner
customer_reviews.text: Vinyl Junkie is right on. This is just plain fantastic especially for $200. Almost everything is dialed in properly. The sound is fantastic, the operating system dead simple to use. I also have a range of headphones and have also found success with Bose IEMs on low volume, Grado 325e on medium volume and HD 600 at 3/4 volume. And all work well. I especially like the 325s with acoustic and percussion and this unit. Yes the controls would be better on top. I wish it could read liner notes in pdf or Word. Still that is just nitpicking.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Playing songs all at once is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was an easy way to play WMA or MP3 or other file formats in a folder one after another - typical way we play song files in a folder. Probably there is a way, not not intuitive to make this happen - should have been easy of by default. It plays one song again and again, very annoying if you are playing from a SD folder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent player with a room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is good. I'm satisfied with that. Software could be better. Crashes sometimes. It can play .cue sheets although I couldn't make it work with multifile cue. Also make sure that your cue's are in Latin or UTF-8 encoding. Couldn't feel much difference when playing with equalizer. The radio reception could be a bit better too. The quality is good but the reception is worse than on my Samsung S9+ using the same headphones (antenna?). Also the manual says that the package includes screen protector - I didn't find any in mine and they are not available online.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Grachev

customer_reviews.title: Basic Music Player
customer_reviews.text: A very basic music player to store and playback my CD collection, worth the price for what I needed. Would it be justified in purchasing the more expensive FiiO or the Astell-Kern at more then double the price of the FiiO M7? Nope......I would rather spend the money saved for a better Turntable for my audio system.....
customer_reviews.author: Kanaka

customer_reviews.title: Fiio need to work on their game
customer_reviews.text: This product froze up the first time I used it. Followed the instructions on line but had to wait for it to run down the battery before it would work again. Product did not come with dac tried to download it but to no avail. If Fiio wants to sell more of these then the dac should already be in the player.
customer_reviews.author: M. Justice

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good product
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am glad I bought this player. However, it could use a few enhancements to make it ideal. 1) When using play "All Songs" it does not show the album name from which the current song is playing. It does show artist and song name. 2) This player lacks a "volume leveling" feature. This feature makes all the tracks playback volume the same so the volume does not fluctuate with each song.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This one is my third fiio music player. The touch control is very responsible and easy to navigate. I like this player.
customer_reviews.author: mitsuo takasue

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a pioneer DAP which I found to be not so user friendly so I returned it . This DAP took a little time to understand how to operate it . For the price it really is a great device with nice sound quality . The only issue I find with this is that the touch screen should be called a touchy screen due to its sensitivity but that minor issue does not detract from the other fine qualities of the player and all in all I am more than satisfied with my purchase .
customer_reviews.author: MR I ?

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a defective device but I've only have had it for less than a week and it's pixelated. Not a scratch on in it. Updated i received a replacement and so far no issue with the screen though it does freeze up every once in awhile. Battery life is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Vic C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth triple what it's cost.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing. It's very responsive and the sound quality is crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Alaine gonz

customer_reviews.title: Nice dedicated music player
customer_reviews.text: I have become fond of this little gizmo. Likes , it expandable, bluetooth works with my car and Bose BT speaker, it has a standard head phone jack, sounds good but better with a headphone amp (Fiio) , batttery life is great if you make sure you shut it off, dislikes: touch screen very sensitive all over, you can change songs without meaning to, operating system (android) kinda weird slow but usable. Overall I like it and I am not burning up my phone listening to music
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great music player
customer_reviews.text: Use this player to load and play much of my cd music collection. Easy to load and easy to create playlists. Music sounds great on my Bluetooth speaker. Great player for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great music player!  Perfect replacement for iPod Classic
customer_reviews.text: My nine year old iPod Classic 160gb stopped working for good and I bought the Fiio M7 to replace it. i've owned the Fiio M7 for two months now and couldn't be happier with it. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: FrakeTrain

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: Great device for a great price. I'm hearing things I've never heard before in songs I've been listening to for decades. The screen can be a little wonky but it isn't bad. Easy to use and good build quality.
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: its a little buggy
customer_reviews.text: I'm having trouble with my m7 . It scans for files when I have already loaded them. Not too bad , but it doesn't detect any and I have to mess with it sometimes for a good while before it starts working right. The Bluetooth doesn't work very well either. But its still a good device.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: A great digital player
customer_reviews.text: I'm a FiiO fan - and this play fulfills all promises. The Android OS is welcome. Bluetooth works as promised. Touchscreen is great. Well worth a few extra dollars!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Music Player
customer_reviews.text: Great player for someone who likes to own and control their own music library. The micro SD slot affords the ability to haves tons of music everywhere you go. Interface is straightforward and easy to use. Sounds great with headphones and on my Bluetooth speaker. Quality product. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob L. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Issues
customer_reviews.text: Could not advance tracks either with touch screen or side buttons. Tracks not displays or played in order even though the SD card that contained albums and tracks worked perfectly on other music players. No help from FIIO support, they are useless as far as I'm concerned. Too bad, I had high hopes for this player since the sound was pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Febraro

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic player. Music is so good! Better than my old MS Zune by far!
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Portable sound machine.
customer_reviews.text: Love this player. Great size and easy to set up. Plugged it into my home stereo and was amazed by the sound. Capacity to hold more than enough music. Definitely would recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbert Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Direct Upgrade to Apple!
customer_reviews.text: The FiiO M7 is a direct upgrade to Apple's old IPods, Better battery-life, better UI, and a better storage capacity if you use a micro SD card in it! The only "downsides" compared to my previous MP3 Player, an Ipod, is an increased size and it is a little harder to organize music on it. It doesn't come with a USC charging cable so make sure to get one before you use it! (luckily I had a spare from my Nintendo Switch Pro Controller I could use.)
customer_reviews.author: Allen Sniperian

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity is problematic.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good player. The interface is wonky. I like the cover art displayed while the song is playing. Thebutton locking mechanism needs some work. The bluetooth connectivity is horrid.
customer_reviews.author: eugene hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good player
customer_reviews.text: Not bad player. I like it. I use with sony 1000xm3
customer_reviews.author: Yaroslav

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unit does not have the updated software when you receive it and it does not function. I was never able to get the downloaded software to work. Waste of money. Not user friendly at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don’t buy Chinese goods but after reading the reviews,thought to give a try.I bought the player this week and quick delivery indeed but it just doesn’t work. Tried to reboot with no luck. Returning today. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: johnson mani

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, weird button placement
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, although i had to disable the side buttons as i kept pausing and skipping tracks when putting the device in my pocket, also i would be great if they as well as the 3.5 mm output were placed differently, otherwise a great product
customer_reviews.author: Geiler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The only downside would be the small space, but micro SD cards are not very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rokusek

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the item, I only wish it list songs by track title instead of file name.
customer_reviews.author: BISHOP

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand by battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have an X5 you are luck to get 2 days stand by battery life. The M7 lasts for weeks on stand by.
customer_reviews.author: R W Brown

customer_reviews.title: have some flaws
customer_reviews.text: the fiio m7 is very good player, but i don’t know is the player problem or is because i put to many music file on it but it become slower and sometime is so slow that it crash. another problem is that there is not way to lock the side bottoms
customer_reviews.author: Zhiye Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Defective Headphone Jack
customer_reviews.text: The headphone jack cut in and out, crackled, and only worked on one channel. I returned the player and got a replacement. It had the same issue. At least four other reviews cite the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is really good for minimal investment. Be sure to update with latest firmware, I am almost certain the sound improved quite a bit after firmware update. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nick77

customer_reviews.title: Great player with different bluetooth options, great sound for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great Hi-Res player from fiio i try with different headphones and earbuds sound is very good, I also try with Sony WI-H700 h.ear with LDAC. 👍 sound excellent. Hope with new firmware bring a little more power the LDAC. And fix few bugs UI.
customer_reviews.author: Flavio Burgali

customer_reviews.title: FiiO
customer_reviews.text: I like the number of songs I could put on it. I didn’t like that it was touchy controls and small font
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The input jack for the earphones broke after two months. Tried multiple earphones, AUX cords, it's definitely the device that's broken
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I cant record FM, why? I have a couple other non DSD capable players that do. RETURNED.
customer_reviews.text: Just that, if recorded FM, I probably would be happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great overall product! Nice modified android operating system. Very clear lows and highs. G Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great details but less bass, sharper blade edges
customer_reviews.text: Corners are too sharp so you can use only with case, bass is not enough and sounds flat while connecting with car through line out
customer_reviews.author: vinothkumar

customer_reviews.title: It's a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: It is a little bigger than most mp3 players and therefore easier to use. The functions are excellent. I am a mp3 novice user, but I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ted royster

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Delivers a great sound. Excellent eq. So slow the interface when the micro SD gets full.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Unable to complete set up, no instructions, no support, no number to call or site to visit,
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Really nice player sound is great awesome touch screen. Could be smaller and support streaming
customer_reviews.author: Charles f.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought Fiio because it is big enough to hold, the screen is big enough to read & hoping it is easy to use. I have been happy with the unit it has met my expectations
customer_reviews.author: debra s.

customer_reviews.title: The player is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my old iPod and found this new player from FiiO. It's a big improvement on the sound! Especially with the lossless FLAC tracks that I just got. The player is easy to use. It fits neatly in my pocket. The interface is good. I really like its sliding gestures of navigating back and to home page, so convenient! And I also ordered FiiO's new Bluetooth aptX receiver. Can't wait to try it with my M7.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies when not in use
customer_reviews.text: No wifi like similarly priced items, battery died after sitting un used for several weeks. Better than most cheap mp3 players but would probably not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: FiiO M7 High Resolution Lossless Music Player with aptX, aptX HD, LDAC HiFi Bluetooth, FM Radio and Full Touch Screen (Black) …
feature_bullets: Enjoy high fidelity wireless audio with aptX, aptX-HD and LDAC Bluetooth codecs
Utilize the ESS Sabre 9018Q2C DAC chip with high SN ratio, native DSD decoding for unsurpassed sound quality
20 Hours play time and 40 Days standby time, owing to the power saving Samsung Exynos 7270 processor
Full touch screen with easy gesture control (a. swipe up from the bottom-left of the screen to go back; b. swipe up from the bottom-right to return to home/main screen)
Supports micro SD card expansion up to 512GB, FM radio and USB Audio output

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars378 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
